poem:
Title: A Dance of Democracy

In the wrestle of words there is hope,
Two adversaries on screens' slope.
Fate penned for a nation at stake,
Trump and Biden, the world they shake.
An arena of ideas, an ethos reforged,
Under Georgia's watchful eyes, they are gorged.
June then September, the Goliaths collide,
In the dance of democracy, their resolve tried.
